website_summaries.verdict: High quality everyday diapers that offer softness and stretch with a helpful wetness indicator.
pros: We love the softness and swaddle concept that wraps little ones in comfort
Moms and Dads appreciate that the leak core and design helps keep little ones drier longer
cons: Occasional leaks, with some experiencing the diaper's inner material leaking out
These may not work for all babies with sensitive skin

customer_reviews.title: Seems like fake!
customer_reviews.text: The one on the right I bought it on Amazon and it's much bigger than normal, more like a number 2. They do not have the entire quilt inside and they are not soft like the traditional ones.
customer_reviews.author: pau

customer_reviews.title: Wish I can give it 0 stars! Don’t let the “cheap price” fool you!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been ordering pampers swaddles for a long time and never had problems with the diapers I received but this specific box was the worst and one of the biggest waste of money ever! Horrible fabric! There has not been 1 of these diapers my daughter worn and had not had a blow out or peed everywhere from!!!! I couldn’t bother using the rest of the diapers in box, what a rip off!! What’s the point of a diaper at this point???? Guess I had bad luck this time around! I guess you either get lucky or you don’t when buying these from here
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you want to constantly be changing clothes, get these diapers. You will have leaks galore!
customer_reviews.text: My kid keeps peeing through these diapers. The mesh webbing on the interior also sticks to his skin, and this didn’t happen before with our first child. Not sure if it is an issue with stuff from amazon lately and if we are getting garbage product, or if pampers is just pumping out crappy diapers now...?? We didn’t have this problem with my last child. He also hasn’t outgrown them and therefore is peeing through them, he is a 5#8oz baby. There is no way he would even fit into a size 1 diaper.
customer_reviews.author: bonj212

customer_reviews.title: but thought that other people were being over dramatic about how crappy they are
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on these diapers before purchasing them, but thought that other people were being over dramatic about how crappy they are. I REALLY wish that I would have listened. They are awful. And now I have a huge box of them. They are either thin, or not the same material as Swaddlers sold in store. My son pees in these diapers one, and I can feel moisture outside of his clothes. I bought a small package of size 1 Swaddlers from meijer, and I can tell you with 100% certainty that these diapers sold on amazon are inferior. DO NOT PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: These diapers have been perfect for me and my infant
customer_reviews.text: These diapers have been perfect for me and my infant. I'm a first time mom, and I was not sure which brand to go with for diapers, but Pampers came highly recommended by friends. I've found that the Swaddlers work best for my little guy. They are a nice material, and he has never had any rashes or skin reactivity to these diapers. They contain all of his waste almost without fail. I've never had any urine leaks with these size 3 diapers, and the only time I've had stool leak is when baby has a blow-out, and I wouldn't expect any diaper to contain that mess!!!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Strong Scent & Too Thin
customer_reviews.text: These were used at the hospital for our newborn that's why I purchased them (Newborn size 1). I opened the box on February 3, 2017. They are scented with a STRONG baby powder smell. Nowhere on the description online or box itself does it indicate it is scented. I dread putting these diapers on my newborn because of the strong smell. Otherwise she hasn't had a problem with it; no cuts, rashes, leaking out, etc. Additionally, these are thinner than what the hospital used. These are low quality diapers. The hospital had the same brand but I don't remember it being this bad. I would not recommend them. I will finish the pack but will not purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Love Pampers. I have used them with all of ...
customer_reviews.text: Love Pampers. I have used them with all of my children. They are super absorbent and they fit well. The kids seem comfortable with them on. Now they have the “wet/dirty” blue stripe on the front and back. It’s a very accurate indicator of what’s happening in there. Also, there is a mesh layer inside the diaper that really pulls wetness and yuck away from baby’s body. Meaning, the diaper can be wet but your baby won’t be. And I mean WET! And poopy. I couldn’t believe how well it worked. Thanks Pampers!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: like over night
customer_reviews.text: I'm not quite sure what people are saying with the knock off brand... this is real deal. O have been buying diapers on Amazon for years. I buy economy all the time and they are the same as in storw bought. The picture of the baby bottom...that only happens when you leave the baby to wet repeatedly, like over night, and the diaper is too full. This doesn't happen every change, nor should it happen at all... that isn't the diapers fault is what I'm trying to say. No chemicals or chemical smells. GREAT BRAND!! especially for sensitive babies. My twins can't use luvs or other generic types and one has extremely sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: gailm

customer_reviews.title: Pee soaks through and makes the clothes wet
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what happened to pampers but these are terrible! Don't buy! I had a subscription set up for these diapers 3 years ago with my first kid and loved the quality and especially the convenience. I started the same thing with the new baby but the diapers soak through the outside. You can feel moisture on the clothes and after changing the wet diaper and setting it aside there's a damp spot on the dresser.
customer_reviews.author: Steck

customer_reviews.title: The best diapers around
customer_reviews.text: The best diapers around, hands down. We tried a few different brands when our daughter was first born, but Pamper's swaddlers were the ones that kept her the cleanest, driest, and least blowouts. They are super soft and she seems comfortable in them. They have the blue streak down the front that let's you know when she has a wet diaper. I feel like they are a little more expensive than other brands, but they work really well, so to be that is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Akimoff

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Brand
customer_reviews.text: I've used Pampers for all 3 of my children. With my oldest we tried multiple brands, but Pampers worked best for us. With my second I didn't even try any other diaper. My youngest has a couple of allergies, and the Swaddlers are the only ones we've found that don't cause her a rash.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea S.

customer_reviews.title: Have had great luck with these diapers
customer_reviews.text: Have had great luck with these diapers! No problems with skin sensitivity, and they are definitely softer than other brands. I don't mind paying more for Pampers Swaddlers. I also consider Swaddlers to be better than the regular Pampers diapers in this size- they are NOTICEABLY softer, and still have the wetness indicator. It's very nice to be able to see if your child is wet or not with a glance. I find the tabs stick well, which isn't always the case with other diapers. We have tried expensive organic diapers, and we actually prefer these.
customer_reviews.author: GertrollaB

customer_reviews.title: The best out there
customer_reviews.text: We tried Huggies, Seventh Generation and Babyganics before deciding that these were the best for our baby. The line in the front of each diaper is easy to read (blue color means there is pee/poop) and you're pretty much guaranteed never to get a blowout that gets into your kid's clothes or the sheets. With the Babyganics in particular, we had two blowouts and one of them stained the baby's onesie. So we switched back to these and have been using them ever since. Definitely an excellent diaper!
customer_reviews.author: K.T.T.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for. Leaks and cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: We never had a problem with Honest Diapers but since the hospital where I delivered used pampers swaddlers, we decide to give it a try. Just no. This is terribly made. It smells like processing, leaked several times already since we got it yesterday and then netting doesn't really wick moisture. Spend a tad bit more for better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality-flimsy, rough material
customer_reviews.text: Have been a loyal pampers customer for acouple years-with my daughter and now with my son. I ddon't know what they have done to these diapers but they are awful. Poor quality-flimsy, rough material, thin, tab placement is off. If your baby has chubby legs you might as well forget it. Change in tab placement also causes diaper to gap in the back. Can't wait for the blowouts with these. Also strange is the quality is worse on these purchased from Amazon than smaller packs purchased at local store. If im going to get a junk diaper I will buy discount brand and save the money. So disappointing. Sorry pampers, you've lost me.
customer_reviews.author: P.Ronn

customer_reviews.title: Won't use anything else!
customer_reviews.text: We received several different brands of diapers as gifts for our newborn. We've stopped using everything but the Pampers; None of the other brands (Huggies included) work nearly as well at absorbing and locking in waste - The Pampers are the only diapers that our baby has been unable to "pee through". Update 2016-05-02 : Regarding "Pampers Swaddlers Diapers, Size 3, One Month Supply, 180 Count" - Maybe our baby pees a lot, but we go through about 1.3 boxes a month.
customer_reviews.author: User_Zero

customer_reviews.title: I thought these were going to be my favorite diapers but they have proven to be my least ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were going to be my favorite diapers but they have proven to be my least favorite. My first issue is that they SMELL, there is a scent in them that I think is suppose be 'fresh' but every time my baby so much as tinkles it smell horrible, because of these diaper I feel like my daughter stinks pretty much all the time. Hate the smell. Second and maybe even most important is the way the legs are cut, there is no indenting for her thighs, it is straight cut from belly button to back which makes them fit poorly. I will be going back to huggies
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Swaddles poop in place.
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are simply the best. They are the only diapers I buy no matter what a friend might have on their registry. They provide great leak protection while being gentle on newborn skin. This size box is perfect for making a 5 layer diaper cake as well (10, 20, 40, 60, 80).
customer_reviews.author: JerseyGal

customer_reviews.title: Love me some swaddlers!
customer_reviews.text: Had these given to me while I was in the hospital, and it’s what we have been using ever since. I have tried other brands via there samples, but none came close to these diapers. I love the color changing line so I can tell if she needs a diaper change without having to physically open her diaper to check.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs_S

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed with Pampers and have cancelled my subscription
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Pampers diapers for almost 4 years. This time Pampers failed me because the Pampers Swaddlers that I bought for my new born are leaking. You can feel the wetness when you lift the baby in your arms. I thought it is just a one time occurrence and ignored it. but have been noticing the same since 3 weeks now with this pack of diapers. I am very disappointed with Pampers and have cancelled my subscription, planning to try other brands and switch.
customer_reviews.author: Harish Yarl

customer_reviews.title: The choice of parents.
customer_reviews.text: I do not have children. Many of my friends are about to have children. They throw diaper parties that I have to bring diapers to. These are the brand of diapers they request. If I am going to have to buy diapers I might as well get the best bang for my buck, and these fit the bill. I have not heard any complaints from my friends or their babies, so I will continue to buy these for future diaper parties.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Noah

customer_reviews.title: Big Summer Blowouts!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second child we've used these diapers with. With my son they were great. We actually switched from Huggies because of leaks and blowouts. Now, with my daughter we've had a ton of leaks and blowouts. Believe me when I say a ton...it's like 2-3 a day. A lot of onesies have been ruined. I can't recall if there is a glaring design change or not in this particular size, but I do recall there being a fold/pocket in the back to prevent blowouts that are not present at this size. We'll see if the next size up has it. Otherwise we might have to give Huggies a second go.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M.

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: Love these. They fit well and hold up well. There were still some blowouts, but I don't think any diaper can prevent them from happening from time to time. If diaper starts to leak, you might check the fit and order up a size. Well worth it to purchase quality. Also, if you subscribe you will save on the price. You can change the size anytime after subscribing as well. Enjoy less worries!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pampers Swaddlers fit my baby best and smell lovely!  Subscribe and save!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon is hands down the best place to buy diapers. You don't pay tax (if you are reading this in the future and the government has changed internet merchant regulations, shame on them) and they have the best prices. Plus, it is so easy to have them shipped to your house and not have to worry about running out. Pampers swaddlers are the best diapers I have tried for my sweetie. Huggies do not fit as well and they let her smell like pee pee. I'm sorry, babies are not meant to smell like urine. They are meant to smell wonderful and sweet and cuddly and like, well, newborn angel babies!
customer_reviews.author: FrugalSuperMommy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent diapers!
customer_reviews.text: Love these diapers! As a new mom I found the wetness indicator line to be incredibly helpful! The diapers fit true to size and we didn't have any problems with leakage, even overnight, or diaper rash. The wetness indicator is a life saver! I could quickly look and see that my son was wet and didn't have to wonder if he was crying because he was wet or hungry. The diapers took the guessing game out of why is he crying.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality... scratchy and cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible quality, feels cheap and scratchy- not like the pampers quality we’ve come to know... something doesn’t feel right about these diapers. I’m wondering if they are legitimately pampers?
customer_reviews.author: Elissa D

customer_reviews.title: The best diapers!
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are by far our favorite. We tried other brands, and although they seem softer, they do not absorb as well and irritated our baby's skin. These last for hours without feeling wet and they have helped tremendously with diaper rash. They have also not leaked through yet, and there have been some very wet diapers! We will not use any other brand!
customer_reviews.author: monkeyfeet

customer_reviews.title: The best diapers
customer_reviews.text: Pampers swaddlers continue to be my favorite diaper. They were the first diapers my daughter used in the hospital 7 months ago. Since then we tried other brands of diapers that were gifted to us or if we stumbled across a fantastic deal. My baby can wear any type of diaper, we've had no trouble with improper fit or irritation with any brand, but pampers swaddlers are our go-to diaper. They are so soft and they keep my baby dry and comfortable now that she sleeps all night.
customer_reviews.author: Kac

customer_reviews.title: Every 10th diaper or so would bust open in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Every 10th diaper or so would bust open in the middle of the night and my son would have the little gel beads everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Pachin

customer_reviews.title: Be careful... Got. 2.boxes of fake pampers
customer_reviews.text: Got 2 boxes of counterfeit pampers... No pampers paperwork inside like Thier usualy is.. And no seasme street characters on it.. Not to mention the interior lining was like. Razor wire to my LO's couldn't figure out why they had bad rashes.. Look at the diapers finaly and figured it out
customer_reviews.author: GravX Reviews

customer_reviews.title: I love Pampers! But they sent my package to the ...
customer_reviews.text: I love Pampers! But they sent my package to the wrong residence in a different state and different city! My address was correct though! So weird... So by the time they sent my new box of diapers they no longer fit my baby which was super disappointing because this box of diapers was such a great deal! They were only 18 cents a diaper! And I couldn't use them... Other than that, I love Pampers and will always keep using them as long as I have babies!!
customer_reviews.author: Lesanna Dahlen

customer_reviews.title: Good for your little one.
customer_reviews.text: After using many different brands, as a mother and daycare worker, I like Pampers for the newborn/infant months. I do change to a different brand as my children get older but for the sake of the review I do like these for the younger age. I also like the yellow/blue wetness line. Very convenient when not wanting to disturb a sleeping baby for a maybe needed diaper change :)
customer_reviews.author: Angela Dalton

customer_reviews.title: These are pampers diapers
customer_reviews.text: Love the deal! I was a little concerned with the bad reviews, but ordered anyway because of amazon's awesome return policy. Once received, I immediately compared them with the pampers I had on hand and they looked exactly the same. Once used, they also function the same way. I'm not sure what the other reviewers got, but my batch is good. Note the packs have the pampers rewards code on them.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Soft
customer_reviews.text: These diapers were used at the hospital, so we kept using them. The little wetness indicator is great. The only thing these are lacking is more elasticity. When baby moves around, while asleep, gaps around then waist open up a bit and oops....pee can soak up out of the gaps. some elastic on the back would provide a more snug fit!
customer_reviews.author: p.doe

customer_reviews.title: Reliable comfort, durability with no leaks if you put them on the baby correctly.
customer_reviews.text: Great value, I bought as a baby shower gift. If you have never tried Pampers on your child, you should try them and you won’t go back to any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Regina H.

customer_reviews.title: well worked diapers no issues
customer_reviews.text: As always pampers diapers work great for my baby. I've used them since I had my older son. They work best to prevent blowouts. I don't like the off brand diapers as I tend to have issues with leaks that I don't have with pampers. I haven't had any issues with the quality of the econo pack that some have seemed to comment on vs getting a smaller more expensive pack.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen T.

customer_reviews.title: Weird chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: My original review of these diapers was 5 stars as I have never had a problem with them. I've bought two boxes off of Amazon for my newborn and with the second box came a weird chemical smell that seems to get stronger when the baby wets his diaper. I have another box that I had bought at Target and for whatever reason I don't get the smell from those diapers. Just the Amazon ones. It's strange. Not sure I will be buying diapers from here anymore.
customer_reviews.author: KJacobson

customer_reviews.title: Not fake...but not the best quality I expect from Pampers.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to redeem the pampers rewards codes from my pampers order so I don't believe these diapers are fake, as some reviews have suggested. However, the box of diapers we got seemed to be of lower quality than pampers we've bought in stores. They seem much thinner and my baby has leaked through many of them, which hasn't been the case before.
customer_reviews.author: dukenurse

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issues! Very unhappy mom and baby...
customer_reviews.text: I loved pampers but... We've had multiple issues with these diapers! The pull tabs tear when we fasten them all the time! Which means lots of unusable diapers in the trash... It's Waste of money and very aggravating especially when you have your hands full with three kiddos and just want to change a diaper to keep your little one content. After being a pampers fanatic for nearly 6 years now we have switched brands completely... :(
customer_reviews.author: Mom_of3

customer_reviews.title: Stuck with a defective product: massive blowouts, leaks recurrently, skin reaction
customer_reviews.text: Poor performance with leaks, blowouts and a weird skin reaction. To make matters worse I couldn't even return the item as the only option for that was a drop off point that was too far away so was terribly inconvenient when caring for a newborn. So we are stuck with a defective product that cannot be used .
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Biondi

customer_reviews.title: The only diapers I'll use
customer_reviews.text: Love these diapers. Really soft, absorbent and easy to put on snugly without pinching or squishing baby's tummy. My baby is 50th percentile for height and weight and I usually err on the side of larger diapers based on the pampers weight chart -- this helps with fabric coverage up the back to prevent blowouts in that direction and also the larger absorbent area keeps baby drier longer.
customer_reviews.author: SeaMama

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used these since our baby was born and so far so good. We have yet to have a diaper rash (knock on wood). Love the stripe that changes color when they pee! We have had some pee outs and blow outs...but I kind of feel like that’s inevitable to some extent.
customer_reviews.author: Sara R.

customer_reviews.title: these are fake and garbage! I am throwing these all away
customer_reviews.text: As all the others reviewers have stated, these are fake and garbage! I am throwing these all away, what a waste of money! I wish I had read the reviews first! There are little gel balls that come off the diaper and I feel like these could be a potential choking hazard!
customer_reviews.author: Molly Kate Harnden

customer_reviews.title: I love how snug these are on my littles bum
customer_reviews.text: I love how snug these are on my littles bum, it's the only diaper we've tried that prevents blowouts (at least for our little one). Plus, the scent of a pampers diapers is just classic baby smell... even if it's due to chemical fragrance.
customer_reviews.author: Cullen

customer_reviews.title: I feel a little wetness, is it leaking?
customer_reviews.text: These work for the most part but I feel a little wetness. It's not a full leak, but sometimes I feel a light coolness on my baby's clothes as if she peed through the diaper a bit. Then I come on here to find that a lot of the reviews say they're not the real pampers. I'm shocked. I did not have this issue with the newborn size. Month 1 size, I'm having issues.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: These are by far my favorite newborn diapers. They do not have a weird smell like some diapers and they fit nicely from front to back. They do not have that little cutout in the front for a newborns healing belly button like some do. I just folded down the top until the bellybutton healed completely. All my children have sensitive skin (yay genetics) and these diapers have never caused a rash. I love them and would recommend them to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Tams

customer_reviews.title: Best price around and for us - best newborn/baby diapers
customer_reviews.text: We've been using swaddlers for both of our babies over the last 2 years - moving to Luvs once bigger diapers are needed. Tried 4+ baby diapers and found these to fit well and have less blowouts than others (though you will still have some). The blue stripe is great! And unlike some diapers we find rashes to be rare in these if changed as needed. Price on Amazon is great and ordering here is convenient
customer_reviews.author: Wingnut

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome I still have some left from the 216 size ...
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome I still have some left from the 216 size 1 and I'm about to get my other shipment. I have no issues whatsoever. This has saved me so much money!' My hubby loves it since I'm a stay at home mom and his the only one getting income and also loves that he Dosent have to go to store to pick them up. It's not fake like ppl say and I always get them on time
customer_reviews.author: Jessica C.

customer_reviews.title: Diaper auto delivery is a wonderful gift!
customer_reviews.text: Want to give a new mom and dad a practical gift that repeats every month? Sign up for auto delivery of pampers diapers. My daughter, who lives on the other side of the country says my gift of monthly diapers is a god send. No trips to the store in a snowstorm for diapers. She just lets me know when my beautiful granddaughter is ready for the next size up. And the money they save every month lets her do something special, like a mani/pedi or a massage. Pampers Swaddlers are very absorbent, no leaks, gentle on the skin. With auto delivery you get them delivered to your door for much less than schlepping them home from the store.
customer_reviews.author: E. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and comfort for infant!
customer_reviews.text: Pampers Swaddlers worked great on my infant. They were extremely soft, and the stretch in the material was perfect to fit her properly. We experienced blow outs with other diaper brands; however, the Pampers Swaddlers we have not experienced any! We will be using Pampers for good now.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: Not normal swaddlers, cheap and thin
customer_reviews.text: I too noticed that the pampers were completely thinner than the other pamper swaddlers that I have purchased. My daughters clothes are damp after she wets her diaper. That has never happened until I started using these pampers. I do agree with many others, the quality of these pampers are not worth saving a few more cents. I'd rather spend a little bit more to get a better quality for my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Tiana

customer_reviews.title: I love having the subscription
customer_reviews.text: I love having the subscription. It's super handy having them delivered! I'm getting spoiled. There's a reason for the name brand, I am impressed... my 4 month baby boy is just finishing a growth spurt and he has been FILLING these! When I secure them tightly enough around his middle we have NO leaks. Sometimes I look in wonder at them. Seriously? How can they hold this much pee/poo?! Also love the indicator line, again I'm spoiled by it.
customer_reviews.author: njensen

customer_reviews.title: Great leak protection and soft to touch and against skin for baby
customer_reviews.text: Great leak protection and soft to touch and against skin for baby. Never a rash or problem. Was gifted a small batch of another brand and one use of theirs sent me running to the store for more of these! Even blow out diapers somehow stay contained.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mason

customer_reviews.title: These diapers are great! They hold a great amount of liquid without ...
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are great! They hold a great amount of liquid without leaking. We come across the occasional blowout, but that seems to happen more so because of the way I'm holding her at the time as opposed to a flaw in the design of the diaper. The Velcro holds well and the fit is great. Having the color changing line to indicate when baby is wet is fantastic feature as well.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal!
customer_reviews.text: This was an amazing deal and it was more than worth the price. Not only did the diapers last us more than a month but he grew out of them before we could finish the box. Our son averages a bowel movement after almost every feeding and that's not counting wet diapers in between, so we change him often and we still didn't get through all of these diapers on a month or before he had a chance to grow out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Mone

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.text: Best diaper out there! No leaks, comfortable......I tried a lot of diapers and this one is the only one I used the entire time my son was in diapers.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hein

customer_reviews.title: Best Diapers
customer_reviews.text: This is the best brand for diapers out in the market. We've used NB, Size 1, now on Size 2, ordered Size 3, and will continue to upgrade as needed. I get tempted to try cheaper brands but I've read a lot more horror stories that's stopped me from straying.
customer_reviews.author: PKiM

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best
customer_reviews.text: These are the only diaper brand that I trust. I have tried Huggies (leaked out the side), Luvs (gave my daughter a rash), and Equate (doesn't absorb poo), and nothing compares to Pampers! You pay for quality, and it holds true with these diapers! Very absorbent and able to handle a big load!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy M.

customer_reviews.title: Poosplosions beware!
customer_reviews.text: We have been alternating between Pampers and the Target brand diapers - both have pros and cons. The Pampers are definitely softer on the outside and make less noise. They keep poosplosions in check and seem to handle a fair amount of pee. I also love the stripe that changes color - one of the Huggies variety that we used didn't have that so it was sometimes a guessing game if there was just a little tinkle. The only place where Target comes out ahead (and not tied) is the price. Pampers are typically pricier unless you find a good price and some coupons.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylan

customer_reviews.title: Love these in every size!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I rarely see any sort of leak or blow out. I think sizing is important; if they're getting too small, it's time to move up to the next size, regardless of how many of the small size you have left. The only time I see a leak is when we are ready to move up to the next size. I use size 2 for my 3 month old and size 5 for my 2 year old (although he's transitioning into a pullup style as he masters potty training)
customer_reviews.author: Julie O.

customer_reviews.title: Better than Baby Dry!
customer_reviews.text: Great protection against leaks and they do a good job keeping moisture away from my son's sensitive bottom. The wetness indicator is a nice feature too. It certainly beats the feel and sniff method! I like Swaddlers better than Baby Dry because they contain the mess better and the Baby Dry diapers do not have a wetness indicator.
customer_reviews.author: Poe Dizzle

customer_reviews.title: Does not leak out of sides
customer_reviews.text: We only use Pampers Swaddlers diapers for my son because it works great and does not leak out of the sides. I have a box of Huggies that I cannot use because it leaks through the sides even though they are both size 1s. We will wait till he is bigger to see if the Huggies works any better since it seems like it is too loose for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: They Work...But Huggies Are Better
customer_reviews.text: These diapers work fine and hold in the mess just as well as Huggies, but they are pretty stiff and not very soft when compared to the Little Snugglers. The leg gussets are also not as deep so they dig into my baby's legs. I almost feel bad putting my little guy in these because the Huggies seem more comfortable and work just as well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Misleading. Size one diapers not newborn.
customer_reviews.text: As a sleep deprived mama found this title to be very misleading. Thought I was purchasing newborn diapers. These are in fact size one. Granted many new babes wear size one however putting both "sizes" in the description is rather misleading and dumb.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Yeh

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these diapers.  The best...
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE pampers swaddlers. They are the best fit for our daugther and rarely, if ever, leak. That would only be the case if she were to have one of those dreaded "explosive" diapers and it wasn't on just perfectly. They have kept us happy for her entire first year. AND I love the wetness indicator stripe. This is amazing and so easy to see through light clothing that you don't have to struggle to take a "peek". Keep it up pampers!
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Fine

customer_reviews.title: This time I though to try pampers again and I think I have found a knockoff which is more expensive than the amazing diapers I h
customer_reviews.text: I think these are knockoff diapers. They are too thin - started leaking, which I never saw in pampers before. I have used pampers before when my baby was born then switched to huggies because my local store only had those. This time I though to try pampers again and I think I have found a knockoff which is more expensive than the amazing diapers I had. After reading the recent customer reviews I find out that this is a recent redesign and they are still selling it on the older posting (hence the good reviews). These are really thin and this is the first time my baby actually cried because she was feeling wet. Never buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Sumit

customer_reviews.title: Working fine after some initial issues
customer_reviews.text: I used to use Huggies Snug and Dry as well as Pampers baby dry for my LO. Both worked well. However, based on good reviews, this time I ordered Pampers Swaddlers, but what a shame. My LO got severe rashes after first use. Not recommended. Update 1: Changing my review from bad to good. After trying few more times, I didn't observe any rashes. Working good
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Pampers swaddlers are great. They are super soft
customer_reviews.text: Pampers are the only diapers we use because my first born was SO allergic to every other diaper (huggies, luvs, honest company.) we didn't want to take a chance with our second baby. Pampers swaddlers are great. They are super soft, the fit is great (neither had problems with leakage and we have a boy and a girl), and the wetness indicator is a great feature (especially at night)!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Cornell

customer_reviews.title: Good for Sensitive Skin
customer_reviews.text: These have been excellent for my LO's sensitive bottom. I change her very often but the chemicals in other diapers gave her a rash (not typical diaper rash). These don't cause a rash and keep her dry.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia B

customer_reviews.title: i used so many diapers and this was a great way to save money on diapers
customer_reviews.text: ah! i used so many diapers and this was a great way to save money on diapers. pampers are by far my favorite diaper ever. they keep my baby dry for hours and she also rarely has blowouts. i also love that they have the strip on them letting me know when she is wet. thanks, pampers!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Love Pampers Swaddlers
customer_reviews.text: Love Pampers Swaddlers. Great deal on amazon 'open box'. The box it's self was re-sealed and slightly bend on one side. However, all the diapers are sealed in their original plastic packaging, inside the box. Perfect! Will definitely purchase Amazon open box Pamers again.
customer_reviews.author: NonnieTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Tried these and huggies. Preferred these. If you're ...
customer_reviews.text: Tried these and huggies. Preferred these. If you're getting too many blowouts, new parent, try to size up even if the next ones look a little big
customer_reviews.author: Ursula Gartz

customer_reviews.title: Dry and Snug
customer_reviews.text: We used Pampers throughout our kids diaper days and didn't really try any others. We had no trouble with the pampers at all. They were great at containing large loads and easy to change. On the swaddlers, we liked the color change to let you know if the kid is wet. That was very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Adams Family

customer_reviews.title: Swaddlers can handle even the largest blow-out!
customer_reviews.text: These are the same brand our baby got at the hospital, we've never had an issue with the Swaddlers version of Pampers. Our little girl could have a major blow-out and it contains it all so far. We switched up to the size 1 as our baby was getting around 12 lbs and the Newborn were starting to get a bit snug.
customer_reviews.author: Infidex

customer_reviews.title: Different product from those I bought from Target or QFC
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely not the same product compared with the same one I bought from Target or QFC. The pad in the center is thinner and smaller. The front is different too. Can Pampers please explain why they are different? Those sold here is special version as it is cheaper than those sold by Target or QFC?
customer_reviews.author: Peng Xie

customer_reviews.title: Guess what i received is a fake product.
customer_reviews.text: i use this pampers diaper size 1 for my boy. the pack i ordered this time is not worth the money and is of no quality. After changing diaper say with in 10 mins the indicator line turns blue and the elastic leaves mark(reddish) in his thighs,i would give 1/5 for this product comparing it with the same pampers that i bought in walmart. Padding is not as thick as original diaper. No idea what to do with this 216 diapers that i bought.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The baby hasn’t arrived so I don’t know if they are truly great but the shipping and product info was exact to what I received. Shipping was extremely fast.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I'm grandpa and bought these because they had the highest ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm grandpa and bought these because they had the highest review. A different brand had negative reviews because the beads fall out. Since these are for my grandaughter, who has a big brother (15-months old), I couldn't risk a cheap brand and have my grandson following her around and eating the beads.
customer_reviews.author: Rob G.

customer_reviews.title: They don't hold much pee!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these since my baby was born, but as soon as I switched to huggies he started sleeping a LOT longer!! I even switched him back to pamper one night and he was fussing and awake a lot sooner. I will not use these anymore!! They also are weird with the sizing!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No leaks, no worries!
customer_reviews.text: This amount is perfect for the entire month. Pampers are made so much better for boys as the absorbency is more throughout the entire diaper. Especially the front since the aim for boys in forward. Even being a little guy, I didn't have to deal with any over leakage. Even when he slept for an entire 8 hours one night. I love pampers and this box is just enough to get me each new shipment every month without worry.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazon Orderer

customer_reviews.title: Best diapers!
customer_reviews.text: Never had a problem with pampers. Lightweight but comfortable & no leakage
customer_reviews.author: Amber Castillo

customer_reviews.title: returned box
customer_reviews.text: I received an opened box. It is supposed to have three packs of 72 diapers. But in the box I received there was one packet open with one less diaper. I think this was a box returned by someone. I do not have any complaints with the product. It is good for my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Vasanth V

customer_reviews.title: Love diaper quality and Suscribe and Save
customer_reviews.text: Shipped every month to my new grand daughter and did the same with my first two grand kids. Suscribe and save make sure you never make diaper runs. I thin I pay about 38.00 for 216 diapers. Now try to find that price anywhere for any diaper with free delivery every month.
customer_reviews.author: londaeric

customer_reviews.title: The brand we like
customer_reviews.text: So we've tried a few different diaper brands now including Huggies and the Target brand. We found these to be the best at keeping everything contained. They fit well and the velcro tabs stay where you put them. The color change indicator is comparable to Huggies and much better than the Target brand. These are the diapers we will stick with and we recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Medicguy

customer_reviews.title: Like these but..
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it was just this box I got or what but the diaper smell seems to be talky strong. I love these diapers because they're easy to put on and have that little yellow strip that turns green when the diaper is wet. But every time I pick my daughter up I get a strong wiff of that diaper smell.. even when get diaper is clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jandjdm

customer_reviews.title: Favorite diapers!
customer_reviews.text: Pampers Swaddlers are my go-to for my baby girl! They are soft and fit her just right- she even wears them overnight and we haven't had one leak! Highly recommend! I use the Subscribe and Save for these and its perfect!
customer_reviews.author: JordanLeigh

customer_reviews.title: I love it as much as a person can love their ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it as much as a person can love their diaper purchase ha ha ha. Pampers has always been my go to brand for buying disposable diapers and ive never had any issues with leakage, diaper rashes, skin irritations, and durability. So overall solid buy
customer_reviews.author: Kim31284

customer_reviews.title: I love Pampers!
customer_reviews.text: Pampers are my favorite diapers brand so I am a little bias, but these are quite soft and my baby loves them. My baby now weighs 16 pounds and they still fit him really well. I also love the fact that they have the pee indicating line... very useful! No rashes or anything since I started using these.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa

customer_reviews.title: A dry butt is a happy butt!
customer_reviews.text: First time dad. I love pampers. I can't tolerate Luvs or Huggies and neither can my kids butt. Seem's like he stays dryer. A dry butt is a happy butt. I love the clear moisture indicator. We got a ton of diapers of various brands from the baby shower and while we're appreciative... it sucks trying to get through two boxes of huggies.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Duggin

customer_reviews.title: The best diapers I have found
customer_reviews.text: I love pampers! My daughter has gotten rashes from every brand out there except this. She doesn't really have sensitive skin. These are the softest diapers I have found.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best buy I could find for the Swaddlers
customer_reviews.text: This is the best buy I could find for the Swaddlers. These seem to be the only brand of diapers that don’t irritate my baby’s skin. I like the wetness indicator too
customer_reviews.author: Jaimie B.

customer_reviews.title: There’s a reason they are preferred by so many hospitals!
customer_reviews.text: The amount of liquid these things can hold is astounding. They are soft as well. Very form fitting. To prevent any spillage have to have the proper fit. No room for error with these. All in all, love them.
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We bought the open box and thus for this amount, it was cheaper than some generic brand diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recieved 192 count not 216 like ordered
customer_reviews.text: Great diapers but am sorely disappointed that I ordered 216 count yet recieved 192 count. I'm also disappointed that I didn't notice the shipping charge was nearly as much as the diapers themselves.
customer_reviews.author: British hedgehog

customer_reviews.title: They are AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: My son peed through and had blowouts ALL the time in other diapers, even the baby dry. I should have gone straight to these as my friend suggested. I'm going to make sure no one else wastes money on other diaper brands! I will never put my son in a different diaper. These hold in everything! They are AMAZING!
customer_reviews.author: Tyson S Flinders

customer_reviews.title: huggies) and love pampers the most by far
customer_reviews.text: have tried quite a few kinds of diapers (pampers, 7th gen, huggies) and love pampers the most by far. 7th gen gave our kid a diaper rash b/c it didn't have the stuff that pulls the moisture away from her skin. and huggies just seem so crunchy and not soft. i know these are bad for the environment, but it's temporary that we have to use them....
customer_reviews.author: jingelso

customer_reviews.title: Love them!!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried the other types of diapers. Maybe we are just diaper snobs, but we love our pampers. It is just worth it to pay a little more to have an excellent product. Plus, with subscribe and save, the price isn't significantly higher than Costco or other cheaper diapers.
customer_reviews.author: JLOW

customer_reviews.title: Love Swaddlers
customer_reviews.text: We've been using these on my 3 month old since she came home from the hospital as a newborn and love them. The hospital used Huggies and I much prefer Pampers. She is breastfed and the only time we've had blowouts is when she hasn't "gone" in 3 days. She also has very sensitive skin and these don't bother her at all.
customer_reviews.author: branjess20510

customer_reviews.title: Size 1 is a total disaster!
customer_reviews.text: We used Pampers Swaddlers from size P-S to NB and now to size 1. It was great from P-S to NB but now we are at size 1, we found out that my daughter woke up crying hysterically of wet diaper (and we are not talking about big wet diaper, but just a small amount of urine she has). During the day, she also cried badly when the diaper was wet. For a while I did not understand why she stopped crying when I used the fan to dry her, and started to cry excessively when I changed a new diaper and put her clothes on. These diapers suck!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Chen

customer_reviews.title: Babies most terrifying BM didn't phase this diaper
customer_reviews.text: My 3.5 month old hadn't pooped for three days and then pooped into this diaper in the early morning after first soaking it with pee while she slept. It was so awful I was afraid to change her expecting poop up to her neck. Nope! This diaper fully contained the pee and her BM. Every baby is shaped differently so these diapers might not work for your baby, but pampers just earned my seal of approval!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Moore

product_meta.title: Diapers Newborn / Size 1 (8-14 lb), 216 Count - Pampers Swaddlers Sensitive Disposable Baby Diapers, (old version) (Packaging May Vary)
product_meta.description:
Wrap your baby in Pampers Swaddlers diapers, our most trusted comfort and protection and the #1 Choice of US Hospitals.* Our Blankie Soft diaper with a unique Absorb Away Liner pulls wetness and mess away from baby's skin to help keep your baby comfortable. It also has a color-changing wetness indicator that tells you when your baby might need a change. Finally, we make sure your baby's delicate belly is protected with the contoured umbilical notch.** *Based on sales of the newborn hospital diaper. **Available in sizes NB–2.

BRAND STORY
By
feature_bullets: Recommended Weight: 8 - 14 Pounds. Pampers Blankie Soft comfort and protection
Pampers Swaddlers diapers are the #1 Choice of US Hospitals (based on sales of the newborn hospital diaper)
Swaddlers wetness indicator tells you when your baby might need a change
Our unique Absorb Away Liner pulls wetness and mess away from your baby's skin
Extra Absorb Channels to help distribute wetness evenly for up to 12 hours of protection
NOTE : "The expiration date is for REWARDS not for the product

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
